doc.after: In 1984, Apple launched the Macintosh, the first personal computer to be sold without a programming language at all.[35] Its debut was signified by "1984", a $1.5 million television commercial directed by Ridley Scott that aired during the third quarter of Super Bowl XVIII on January 22, 1984.[36] The commercial is now hailed as a watershed event for Apple's success[37] and a "masterpiece".[38][39]
